translation.en: I got a real feeling of hope about this place.
translation.ja: この地に希望を感じた

translation.en: When Steve drive from Cairo by bus, all the way to Dahab,
translation.ja: スティーヴンは カイロからダハブに着くと

translation.en: he just throw the bag in the room.
translation.ja: 荷物を部屋に投げて “飲もう”と 荷物を部屋に投げて “飲もう”と スキューバダイバー マフムード

translation.en: He just, Where's the bar? Let's go have a drink.
translation.ja: 荷物を部屋に投げて “飲もう”と スキューバダイバー マフムード

translation.en: Next day, he go diving.
translation.ja: 翌日はダイビング

translation.en: He become a friend. We see each other every day.
translation.ja: 彼と親しくなり毎日 会った

translation.en: He loved the Bedouin culture. He learned Arabic.
translation.ja: 彼はベドウィンの文化を 愛してた

translation.en: We become like family.
translation.ja: 俺たちは家族だった

translation.en: He stayed down there, making a living instructing scuba diving.
translation.ja: スキューバダイビングを 教えながら そこで生活した

translation.en: So I arrived here to do my Divemaster course,
translation.ja: 監視員コースに参加して スティーヴンと出会った 監視員コースに参加して スティーヴンと出会った フリーダイバー クリストフ

translation.en: and that was Steve.
translation.ja: 監視員コースに参加して スティーヴンと出会った フリーダイバー クリストフ

translation.en: He was my instructor.
translation.ja: 俺の先生だ

translation.en: Before long, we were hanging out daily.
translation.ja: 毎日 遊ぶようになって

translation.en: And going out dancing.
translation.ja: ダンスに出かけた

translation.en: Dahab, for Steve, a second home.
translation.ja: ダハブは彼の第二の故郷だ

translation.en: He had a little house of his own. He just loved it.
translation.ja: 息子には実際 小さな家があった

translation.en: 'Cause he told me at one stage,
translation.ja: とりこになってた

translation.en: I've discovered this new thing called free diving, and it's the business.
translation.ja: “フリーダイビングに 出会った”と

translation.en: Steve asked me to join him on a free dive session.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングに誘われた

translation.en: The first time I dived down, holding my breath, all the problems and the shit from daily life just vanished.
translation.ja: 初めて息を止めて潜った時 日常の悩みは消え去った

translation.en: It doesn't exist down there. It's beautiful.
translation.ja: 美しい世界が広がっていた

translation.en: Steve just fell in love with free diving. And especially the Blue Hole.
translation.ja: 彼はフリーダイビングと “ブルーホール”に夢中

translation.en: You literally walk from the beach into an abyss.
translation.ja: ビーチから底知れぬ深海へ

translation.en: Like, there is this gaping hole in the coral reef,
translation.ja: サンゴ礁に ぽっかり穴が開いている

translation.en: which really, like, wants you to go down there.
translation.ja: 人々を誘い込むようにね

translation.en: And then there's this arch, like a chapel underwater.
translation.ja: そして アーチが待ち構えている

translation.en: Unfortunately, it also has a… a bad reputation.
translation.ja: 評判の悪い場所でもある

translation.en: It took lives.
translation.ja: 命を奪うから

translation.en: This is the most dangerous dive site on Earth.
translation.ja: 地球で最も危険な ダイビングスポット

translation.en: It's thought to have claimed over 100 lives.
translation.ja: 命を落としたのは １００人以上

translation.en: In terms of fatalities, the Blue Hole is even more perilous than Mount Everest.
translation.ja: ブルーホールは エベレストより危険だ

translation.en: As well as myself,
translation.ja: フリーダイビングの成功者は 僕も含めて わずか

translation.en: there's only a handful of people who have free dived through it.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングの成功者は 僕も含めて わずか 世界記録保持者 ウィリアム

translation.en: Natalia Molchanova was the only woman to do it.
translation.ja: 女性では ナタリア･モルチャノワだけ

translation.en: Diving the Arch has left a lasting impression on me.
translation.ja: 〈アーチを潜ったのは 忘れられない〉

translation.en: This is the dive that unlocked something within herself. A fearlessness that she didn't know was there.
translation.ja: あれで彼女の心が解放され 恐れ知らずになり

translation.en: It made her the best free diver in the world.
translation.ja: 世界一のフリーダイバーに 世界一のフリーダイバーに スポーツライター アダム

translation.en: With the Arch, you've got to know if you're ready for it.
translation.ja: アーチに挑むには 覚悟が必要だ

translation.en: It's a really deceiving place to dive.
translation.ja: ダイバーを 迷わせる場所なんだ

translation.en: You have to find the exit.
translation.ja: 出口を探す必要がある

translation.en: If you aren't able to see it clearly for any reason, you're basically on your own.
translation.ja: 視界が悪くても 助けてくれる人は居ない

translation.en: If something does go wrong, there's no way to come up.
translation.ja: 問題が起きても浮上できない

translation.en: There's 30 meters of rock over your head.
translation.ja: 頭上に30メートルの岩がある

translation.en: Outside the Blue Hole,
translation.ja: ブルーホールのそばには

translation.en: there are the memory stones remembering the people who died there.
translation.ja: 亡くなった人々をしのぶ 石碑が並んでる

translation.en: My boyfriend died in… in the Blue Hole,
translation.ja: 私の恋人もブルーホールで 命を落とした 私の恋人もブルーホールで 命を落とした 水中写真家 クリスティーナ

translation.en: just when I moved to Egypt.
translation.ja: 私の恋人もブルーホールで 命を落とした 水中写真家 クリスティーナ 私の恋人もブルーホールで 命を落とした

translation.en: It is dangerous because it is deep.
translation.ja: 深いから危険なの

translation.en: It is always the ocean. And we are nothing.
translation.ja: 海を前にしたら人間は無力よ

translation.en: So you've said that your objective
translation.ja: あなたの目標は

translation.en: is to become the second woman in the world, after Natalia Molchanova,
translation.ja: アレッシアへの インタビュー ナタリア･モルチャノワに 続くこと ナタリア･モルチャノワに 続くこと

translation.en: to conquer all the absolute world records.
translation.ja: 世界記録を 全て更新することですね

translation.en: So how long do you think this is gonna take you?
translation.ja: いつ達成できそうですか？

translation.en: I don't know.  Of course, it's a dream.
translation.ja: 分からない 目標だけどね

translation.en: Really, a dream for every athlete, I think. But it's really difficult.
translation.ja: 全選手の夢だと思うけど 実現は楽じゃない

translation.en: Natalia Molchanova, champion of the deep,
translation.ja: 深海の覇者 ナタリア･モルチャノワ

translation.en: holding over 40 free diving records, some of them incredible, death- defying feats.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングの世界で 40以上もの記録を持ちます

translation.en: Today, my dive was 101 meters.
translation.ja: ナタリア･モルチャノワ 今日は１０１メートル

translation.en: That's 101 meters down and up.
translation.ja: 101メートル潜水して浮上

translation.en: More than two Statues of Liberty, stacked ground to torch.
translation.ja: 自由の女神２つ分以上の 距離です

translation.en: Natalia was the first female free diver to reach 101 meters
translation.ja: ナタリアは 大会で101メートルに 到達した最初の女性

translation.en: in competition.
translation.ja: 大会で101メートルに 到達した最初の女性 フリーダイビング審判 フランチェスカ

translation.en: And she held that number for a very long time.
translation.ja: フリーダイビング審判 フランチェスカ その記録は 長年 破られなかった その記録は 長年 破られなかった

translation.en: So 101 was the magical number Alessia was trying to beat.
translation.ja: 101という数字を アレッシアは超えたかった

translation.en: I want to improve by a few meters. In fact, I hope to go well beyond 90 meters,
translation.ja: あと数メートル伸ばして 90メートルを超えたいわ

translation.en: to then touch the three- digit number in a couple of years.
translation.ja: 数年後には ３桁の世界に到達したい

translation.en: Everybody must have a dream and put all their effort in.
translation.ja: 誰しも夢を持って 全力を尽くすべきだわ

translation.en: And really, everything is possible.
translation.ja: 何だって可能よ

translation.en: Can you describe the feeling of diving at those-- those kind of depths?
translation.ja: あんな深くまで潜る時の 気持ちは？

translation.en: Talk about the feeling on the body of the pressure.
translation.ja: 体への水圧について 教えてください

translation.en: The deeper I'm diving, the pressure compresses the air in my lungs,
translation.ja: 深く潜るほど 肺の中の空気が圧縮される

translation.en: until my lungs are the size of my fist.
translation.ja: 肺が拳くらいの大きさに なるまでね

translation.en: After 30 meters, the pressure pushes me down.
translation.ja: 30メートルを超えると 水圧で沈んでいく

translation.en: It's called the free fall. And this is, for me, the best part.
translation.ja: “フリーフォール”という 私の大好きな状態

translation.en: It feels like you are flying.
translation.ja: 飛んでるみたいなの

translation.en: The silence, it's unique.
translation.ja: 独特の沈黙が広がっている

translation.en: It's like being in the last quiet place on the Earth.
translation.ja: 地球に残る 最後の静かな場所みたい

translation.en: There's a surrender element to it. It's like a high.
translation.ja: あらがえない快感があるね

translation.en: But getting sucked to the bottom of the sea can be scary, even for free divers.
translation.ja: ただフリーダイバーでも 海底に吸い込まれるのは怖い

translation.en: You have to break this deep meditation.
translation.ja: 黙想から脱する必要がある

translation.en: 'Cause coming back to the surface, that's when the work really starts.
translation.ja: 水面に戻るところからが本番

translation.en: You've gotta swim the length of a 70- storey skyscraper.
translation.ja: 70階建て超高層ビルを 上るんだ

translation.en: Swimming against all that pressure, it's like swimming against the current.
translation.ja: 流れに逆らって 泳ぐようなものさ

translation.en: By then, your oxygen supply's already dwindled.
translation.ja: その頃には 酸素量は減っている

translation.en: You're kicking hard so your heart rate's increasing, burning that oxygen quicker.
translation.ja: 力強いキックで 酸素は急速に消費される

translation.en: You're getting to the point where you don't have enough oxygen to keep the systems going.
translation.ja: 体の機能を保てないほど 酸素が減ると⸺

translation.en: That's when you can have a blackout.
translation.ja: 失神(ブラックアウト)する

translation.en: The brain basically just turns itself off.
translation.ja: 脳の働きが停止するんだ

translation.en: It doesn't mean that your brain is dying.
translation.ja: 脳が死ぬわけじゃない

translation.en: But it's kind of like a safety mechanism.
translation.ja: 防衛本能だよ

translation.en: The brain preserves itself by shutting off all its functions.
translation.ja: 脳が自らを守るため 全機能を止める

translation.en: And from that moment, you still have one or two minutes before brain damage would start to occur.
translation.ja: その瞬間から 脳障害の発生までは１〜２分

translation.en: Right, one more.
translation.ja: もう１回

translation.en: If you don't have the right kind of medical attention, it can go downhill pretty quick.
translation.ja: 適切な治療を受けないと すぐに悪化する

translation.en: It's definitely not something to be taken lightly.
translation.ja: 侮っちゃいけない

translation.en: For years, Steve and I were always trying to dive deeper.
translation.ja: スティーヴンと俺は より深みを目指した

translation.en: It became like a game between us. I was going for the Belgian record.
translation.ja: 競うように 俺はベルギー記録を狙い

translation.en: He was chasing the Irish one, which was 61 meters.
translation.ja: 彼はアイルランド記録 61メートルを目指した

translation.en: When you start competing, you wanna push yourself.
translation.ja: 競い始めると無理したくなる

translation.en: He had a few blackouts in the beginning.
translation.ja: 彼は当初 何度か失神した

translation.en: He likes to bang his head on the wall. You know, really, like, Let's do this! And, like, I can't, but I'm gonna do it anyway.
translation.ja: 壁に頭を打ちつけるように 彼は“絶対 やってやる”と

translation.en: - How deep? - Sixty.
translation.ja: どう？ 水深60メートル　クソ

translation.en: - Okay. - Shite.
translation.ja: 水深60メートル　クソ

translation.en: But Steve never gives up.
translation.ja: 彼は決して諦めなかった

translation.en: And it made him very proud to be the best Irish.
translation.ja: アイルランドで一番になった

translation.en: The other attraction of free diving was that it was a boundary.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングの 他の魅力は限界の存在だ

translation.en: A boundary to be pushed.
translation.ja: 限界を押し広げるんだ

translation.en: Free diving is an extreme sport.
translation.ja: 過激な(エクストリーム)スポーツだよ

translation.en: And extreme sports have extreme consequences.
translation.ja: だから過激な結果をもたらす

translation.en: Stephen?
translation.ja: おい

translation.en: Steve had a really, really strong blackout.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは 激しく失神した

translation.en: The safety team just didn't know what to do with him.
translation.ja: 救助チームも 対応に困っていた

translation.en: He almost died there.
translation.ja: 彼は死にかけた

translation.en: He didn't want anyone else going through that. So he started to be interested in being a safety diver.
translation.ja: 誰も同じ経験をしないように 彼は救助ダイバーを目指した

translation.en: Steve had the best background for the job
translation.ja: 最高の適任者だった

translation.en: because the only other person that can do a safety for a free diver is a free diver.
translation.ja: フリーダイバーの 安全を守れるのは同業者だけ

translation.en: As a scuba diver, you can't be a safety for a free diver because they go up slowly to decompress.
translation.ja: スキューバダイバーは ゆっくり浮上するから無理だ

translation.en: So if something happens, you have to react fast.
translation.ja: 何か起きたら即対応が必要だ

translation.en: 99% of all free diving incidents happen within the last ten meters.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングの 事故の99％は 最後の10メートルで発生

translation.en: If there is an issue, we close the airways so they can't swallow water, and we take them to the surface.
translation.ja: 気道をコントロールしながら フリーダイバーを水面へ

translation.en: Please get out of the way for the safety.
translation.ja: 救助のために どいて

translation.en: He worked very hard to make a name for himself.
translation.ja: 名を成すため 彼は懸命に働いた

translation.en: No. I'm doing it myself. So, uh…
translation.ja: 僕自身で…

translation.en: After a while, Steve got the chance to be on the safety team in Kalamata,
translation.ja: 彼はカラマタで 救助チームに入る機会を得た

translation.en: which was his first international big competition.
translation.ja: 彼にとって初の国際大会だ

translation.en: That's all good. Put it down.
translation.ja: ギリシャ カラマタ 2013年 ＡＩＤＡ世界選手権

translation.en: Natalia's son, Alexey Molchanov, was the men's world record holder at the time.
translation.ja: ナタリアの息子アレクセイは 当時 男子の世界記録保持者

translation.en: He was going for the deepest dive ever.
translation.ja: 彼は新記録に挑んだ

translation.en: And his mom is watching.
translation.ja: 母親の前でね

translation.en: Safety, keep your distances.
translation.ja: 彼から離れて

translation.en: Eighty.
Steve was the first safety.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは第１救助員

translation.en: That means he has to dive the deepest.
translation.ja: つまり一番 深く潜る

translation.en: Stephen kicked down to 30 meters.
translation.ja: 彼は30メートル下まで進んだ

translation.en: You have to know, as a safety diver, you take in a mouthful of air, you go down,
translation.ja: 救助ダイバーは口いっぱいに 空気を吸って潜り⸺

translation.en: and if everything goes right, you just swim up together.
translation.ja: 何も無ければ一緒に水面へ

translation.en: You're never there for longer than a minute.
translation.ja: １分以上は滞在しない

translation.en: But Steve was already waiting at 30 meters for quite some time,
translation.ja: 彼は水深30メートルで 長い間 待っていて

translation.en: - so he's running out of air. -
translation.ja: そろそろ酸素不足だった

translation.en: Come on, Alexey.
translation.ja: 来い アレクセイ

translation.en: 3'30, it's a very long dive time.
translation.ja: ３分30秒は長すぎる

translation.en: Andrea, you go down as well.
translation.ja: アンドレアも潜れ

translation.en: - Trouble. - Yeah.
translation.ja: 問題発生

translation.en: Trouble?
translation.ja: 本当？

translation.en: Steve started to have contractions. He's seconds away from the blackout.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは けいれんを 起こして失神寸前だった

translation.en: But then he saw Alexey get into trouble around 40 meters.
translation.ja: 水深40メートル付近で 危ういアレクセイを発見し

translation.en: Split- second decisions. Save Alexey or save himself.
translation.ja: アレクセイと自分の どちらを救うか即決した

translation.en: Breathe, Alexey. Breathe.
translation.ja: アレクセイ 息を吸って

translation.en: - Breathe, Alex. - Breathe for me.
translation.ja: 呼吸して

translation.en: - Breathe. - Breathe, mate. You're good.
translation.ja: 助かったぞ

translation.en: I had severe lung damage.
translation.ja: 肺に障害が起きていた

translation.en: My mama told me that Steve saved me.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは恩人だ

translation.en: I am very grateful for his… this selfless act.
translation.ja: 彼の献身的な行動に 心から感謝している

translation.en: And that was, like, my first meet with Stephen, this accident.
translation.ja: あの事故が 彼との出会いだった あの事故が 彼との出会いだった 世界記録保持者 アレクセイ あの事故が 彼との出会いだった

translation.en: From that moment on, he was really the star of the competition. Everybody knew him. Stephen Keenan.
translation.ja: あの瞬間から大会の主役は スティーヴン･キーナン

translation.en: Who saved the world champion.
translation.ja: 王者を救った男だ

translation.en: One of the things about that story was how amazing the safety diver was.
translation.ja: 救助ダイバーの すごさが分かる

translation.en: At that time, it was the deepest blackout safety dive in competition.
translation.ja: あの水深での大会での救助は 例が無かった

translation.en: I consider that an act of heroism.
translation.ja: 英雄的行為だ

translation.en: To save Natalia's son,
translation.ja: スティーヴンは ナタリアの息子を救うために

translation.en: Stephen took his job as a safety diver so seriously that he put himself at risk.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは ナタリアの息子を救うために 救助ダイバーとして 自らを危険にさらした

translation.en: We're on day three of training.
translation.ja: 練習３日目よ

translation.en: I'm really pleased, because I've already beaten my personal best. I've done 88 meters.
translation.ja: 88メートルで 自己ベストを更新できて最高

translation.en: Alessia was inching closer and closer to that magical number, 101 meters.
translation.ja: 驚異的な記録101メートルに アレッシアは近づいていた

translation.en: But she wasn't the only one.
translation.ja: でもライバルが居た

translation.en: Excellent dive.
translation.ja: お見事

translation.en: Hanako Hirose of Japan was a strong challenger.
translation.ja: 日本の廣瀬花子は強敵だった

translation.en: Hanako has an innate connection to the sea.
translation.ja: 花子は海とつながっている

translation.en: It's something she was just born to do.
translation.ja: 生粋のフリーダイバーだ

translation.en: I often imagine myself swimming…
translation.ja: 日本代表 廣瀬花子

translation.en: Hanako was going deeper and deeper and deeper. And Alessia had to respond.
translation.ja: どんどん深く潜る花子に アレッシアは対抗した

translation.en: Alessia Zecchini was extraordinary.
translation.ja: アレッシアは別格です

translation.en: Her dive was extremely elegant in every respect.
translation.ja: 彼女の潜水はエレガント

translation.en: We had this amazing rivalry between Hanako and Alessia.
translation.ja: 花子とアレッシアは いいライバルだった

translation.en: Hanako very consistently moved through the depths.
translation.ja: 花子は着実に 深海を進んでいた

translation.en: Alessia would come back at her.
translation.ja: アレッシアも負けてない

translation.en: Eighty- nine meters.
translation.ja: 89メートル

translation.en: Ninety.
- - Ninety- two.
Ninety- three.
Tell us how deep your dive was.
translation.ja: どこまで潜ったんですか？

translation.en: Ninety- four meters.
translation.ja: 94メートルですね

translation.en: - How many meters? - Ninety- four.
translation.ja: 深さは？ 94メートル

translation.en: Wow. With Zecchini, we're not gonna stop.
translation.ja: ゼッキーニは止まりません

translation.en: There had been this dominance by Natalia Molchanova for so many years.
translation.ja: ナタリアの時代は長かった

translation.en: And then suddenly, these women were so close.
translation.ja: そこへ突然 現れたのが この２人

translation.en: But when you push close to a limit, trying to set world records,
translation.ja: だが世界記録を狙い 限界に迫ると

translation.en: there's a lot that can go wrong.
translation.ja: 調子を崩すことがある

translation.en: She is considered to be one of the greatest athletes ever
translation.ja: 世界で最も危険な競技 フリーダイビング

translation.en: in what is one of the world's deadliest extreme sports.
translation.ja: 世界で最も危険な競技 フリーダイビング 史上最高の選手 ナタリア･モルチャノワが

translation.en: Free diving.
translation.ja: 史上最高の選手 ナタリア･モルチャノワが

translation.en: Natalia Molchanova went for a dive on Sunday, and she simply vanished.
translation.ja: 史上最高の選手 ナタリア･モルチャノワが 日曜に潜水中 姿を消しました

translation.en: Natalia Molchanova disappeared off the coast of Spain.
translation.ja: ナタリアは スペイン沖で消えた

translation.en: They didn't recover her body.
translation.ja: いまだ行方不明よ

translation.en: Molchanova's son, Alexey, a record- breaking free diver himself, told the New York Times,
translation.ja: フリーダイバーで ナタリアの息子アレクセイは

translation.en: It seems she'll stay in the sea. I think she would like that.
translation.ja: “母は水中が 好きなんです”と

translation.en: It was all too surreal.
translation.ja: 信じられなかった

translation.en: I was shocked.
translation.ja: ショックだった

translation.en: It was really sad because she was so strong.
translation.ja: 彼女は強かったから 悲しかった

translation.en: We lost Natalia Molchanova.
translation.ja: ナタリアは帰りません

translation.en: And in recognition of her great accomplishments, please join me for a one- minute breath- hold.
translation.ja: 彼女の偉業をたたえて １分間 息を止めましょう

translation.en: It shocked the free diving world.
translation.ja: 業界は衝撃を受けた

translation.en: They realized that they're more at risk than they thought.
translation.ja: 想像以上に危険だと 気付いてね

translation.en: Because if it can happen to Natalia, the greatest ever,
translation.ja: 最強のナタリアの身に 起きたことは

translation.en: it can happen to anybody at any time.
translation.ja: 誰にでも起きる

translation.en: After Natalia's accident, I began to realize that it could be dangerous.
translation.ja: ナタリアの事故があって 危険性を より理解した

translation.en: I was going deeper and deeper.
translation.ja: 私は さらに深みへ

translation.en: It's black. It's dark. You feel locked inside.
translation.ja: 真っ暗で 閉じ込められているみたい

translation.en: You can see things that don't exist.
translation.ja: 幻が見えることもある

translation.en: I was too scared.
translation.ja: すごく怖かった

translation.en: I wanted to turn around and go back.
translation.ja: 空中に戻りたかったわ

translation.en: I didn't feel safe.
translation.ja: 不安だった

translation.en: Stephen had an idea that he could use his own experience as a safety diver
translation.ja: スティーヴンは 救助ダイバーの経験を生かし

translation.en: to open this center for free diving.
translation.ja: 活動拠点を作ろうと考えた

translation.en: Stephen and his friends saved some money.
translation.ja: 息子は友人と お金をためて

translation.en: They built a premises on the seafront in Dahab.
translation.ja: ダハブの海沿いに 拠点を建てた

translation.en: Here, uh… in front of my free diving shop.
translation.ja: ここがフリーダイビング店 ここがフリーダイビング店 〝ダハブ･ フリーダイバーズ〞

translation.en: This is where I'm working.
translation.ja: 僕の仕事場だ

translation.en: He was very proud to tell me he was finally making a success of his business,
translation.ja: 息子は ついに結果を出して 自慢げだった

translation.en: following his dream.
translation.ja: 夢を追ったんだ

translation.en: I was so proud of him. He finally had this purpose.
translation.ja: 目標を定めた彼を見て 誇らしく思った

translation.en: Hey, Steve. Hi!
translation.ja: スティーヴン

translation.en: Hello, hello!
translation.ja: やあ どうも

translation.en: It's a nice, chilled evening in Dahab free divers.
translation.ja: 日暮れの ダハブ･フリーダイバーズ

translation.en: When I first met him, I was super intimidated.
translation.ja: 彼と会った時は緊張した 彼と会った時は緊張した フリーダイバー リリー

translation.en: He had this massive reputation as the best safety diver.
translation.ja: 救助ダイバーとして有名で

translation.en: I heard about the famous rescue he did for Alexey.
translation.ja: アレクセイ救出の話も 聞いていた

translation.en: I was looking for a place to teach free diving. They asked if I wanted to join the team. I said, Yes, sure.
translation.ja: 講師になりたかった時 彼らに誘われて快諾した

translation.en: I was in charge of social media.
translation.ja: 私の担当はＳＮＳ

translation.en: And Steve's not the type to put himself in the limelight. But for me, it was obvious.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは 注目されたがらなかったけど

translation.en: Steve, come on! Like, you're super famous in the community. You have to start promoting yourself.
translation.ja: “業界の有名人なんだから アピールしなきゃ”と訴えた

translation.en: Because Stephen knew all the free divers,
translation.ja: 〝スティーヴン･ キーナンの講師コース〞 彼は顔が広かったから

translation.en: they were able to invite all these big names, like Alexey Molchanov, to give workshops.
translation.ja: アレクセイとか 大物フリーダイバーを呼べた

translation.en: And this attracted a lot of free divers. The school became super famous.
translation.ja: 多くの生徒が集まり スクールも有名に

translation.en: For you, what is success in life?
translation.ja: あなたにとって 人生の成功とは？

translation.en: I suppose success is fulfilling your aspirations, goals, dreams.
translation.ja: 願望や目標 夢を 実現することかな

translation.en: I'm currently living in Egypt, where I run a free diving center.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングの施設を 僕は運営していて

translation.en: I guess I'm happy in that respect. I like what I do.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングの施設を 僕は運営していて その点では幸せだ

translation.en: Other parts of my life are not so successful, I guess.
translation.ja: 他は あまり うまくいってない

translation.en: Unfortunately, I'm a 38- year- old man, and I don't have any kids.
translation.ja: 残念ながら 僕は38歳なのに 子供が居ない

translation.en: I suppose that's, people say, something that I haven't quite fulfilled.
translation.ja: 周りから見たら 物足りない人生かもね

translation.en: He had some relationships in Dahab, but, uh, nothing that lasted.
translation.ja: 何人かと付き合っていたけど 長続きしなかった

translation.en: He would've liked to, like, fall in love and have a long- term relationship and kids.
translation.ja: 恋に落ち 真剣交際して 子供が欲しかったと思う

translation.en: Part of him was missing that side.
translation.ja: 彼の人生で欠けてた部分ね

translation.en: He needed to meet a super special person.
translation.ja: 運命の人を待っていた

translation.en: Thank you so much for taking the time to talk to me, and for all the listeners of the show too.
translation.ja: 番組に出演してくださり ありがとうございます

translation.en: Thank you. It's a major pleasure.
translation.ja: こちらこそ

translation.en: Do you think you push too hard sometimes in search of records?
translation.ja: 記録のために 頑張り過ぎることは？

translation.en: I guess that's, uh, maybe more typical of younger athletes.
translation.ja: 若い選手たちには ありがちですよね

translation.en: Yeah, maybe, sure.
translation.ja: ええ そうね

translation.en: We had no idea she was after the world record.
translation.ja: 娘が世界記録を 狙ってるなんて知らなかった

translation.en: She doesn't like to worry us, so she wouldn't tell us.
translation.ja: 私たちが心配するから 娘は言わない

translation.en: What would you like to accomplish in the next few months?
translation.ja: 数か月後の目標は？

translation.en: I would like to go deeper.
translation.ja: より深く潜ること

translation.en: I would like to do the world record.  That's my goal.
translation.ja: 世界記録を出したい それが目標ね

translation.en: When is your next competition?
translation.ja: 次の大会は？

translation.en: Vertical Blue.
translation.ja: バーチカルブルー

translation.en: Welcome to Vertical Blue in the Bahamas.
translation.ja: バハマのバーチカルブルーに ようこそ

translation.en: We have 42 competitors from all around the globe
translation.ja: 全世界から集まった 42人の選手

translation.en: who are announcing ten different national records.
translation.ja: 10か国の記録更新を 目指します

translation.en: Vertical Blue is like the Wimbledon of free diving.
translation.ja: 例えるなら ウィンブルドン選手権ね

translation.en: It's gonna be a beautiful day. Lot of great dives going on today.
translation.ja: ダイビングに ぴったりの好天だ

translation.en: Only the best of the best are invited.
translation.ja: 最高の選手だけが招かれる

translation.en: Alessia Zecchini, and I'm from Italy.
translation.ja: アレッシア･ゼッキーニよ

translation.en: Within the competition, there is an exceptional team of medics and safeties.
translation.ja: 大会には優秀な医師や 救助ダイバーがそろっている

translation.en: Stephen, want to introduce the safety team?
translation.ja: 救助チームの紹介を

translation.en: I wanna make sure there's a good dynamic between the safety team and athletes. That's vitally important to me.
translation.ja: 救助チームと選手たちの いい関係を築きたいです

translation.en: Stephen was working as a chief of safety in Vertical Blue.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは 救助チームのトップ

translation.en: Being responsible for the overall safety of this, like, one of the biggest free diving events in the world.
translation.ja: フリーダイビング界で 最大の催しの責任者だ

translation.en: There will be two safeties always to meet you, a deep and shallow.
translation.ja: 深海と浅瀬に それぞれ救助ダイバーが居て

translation.en: The deep will meet you between anywhere from 20 to 40 meters, depending on the dive.
translation.ja: 深海の救助ダイバーは 20～40メートル下です

translation.en: We take safety very seriously at Vertical Blue.
translation.ja: この大会は安全対策に真剣だ

translation.en: One of the only incidents,
translation.ja: 死亡事故が起きたからね 死亡事故が起きたからね バーチカルブルー創始者 ウィリアム

translation.en: fatal incidents that's happened in competition,
translation.ja: 死亡事故が起きたからね バーチカルブルー創始者 ウィリアム バーチカルブルー創始者 ウィリアム バーチカルブルー創始者 ウィリアム 犠牲者はアメリカ人選手の ニック･メヴォリ 犠牲者はアメリカ人選手の ニック･メヴォリ

translation.en: was a death here of an American athlete, Nick Mevoli.
translation.ja: 犠牲者はアメリカ人選手の ニック･メヴォリ

translation.en: Never take a dive for granted.
translation.ja: 最後かもしれないと思って 本気で潜るべきだ

translation.en: You don't know what… you don't know what dive is gonna be your last.
translation.ja: 最後かもしれないと思って 本気で潜るべきだ フリーダイバー ニック

translation.en: Nick had a long history of pushing a little bit too hard.
translation.ja: ニックは以前から 無理をする選手だった

translation.en: And things catastrophically went wrong.
translation.ja: そして破滅的な事態に陥った

translation.en: Nick had a lung squeeze.
translation.ja: 肺のスクイズを起こしたの

translation.en: With the lung squeeze,
translation.ja: 肺が締めつけられる(スクイズ)と

translation.en: the blood vessels inside your lungs can burst
translation.ja: 肺が締めつけられる(スクイズ)と 肺の血管が破れ 血液が気腔へ漏れる

translation.en: and leak blood into your air spaces.
translation.ja: 肺の血管が破れ 血液が気腔へ漏れる

translation.en: We're talking about tissue that is torn and then scarred.
translation.ja: 組織が裂けて 傷ついてしまうってこと

translation.en: If you are consistently injuring yourself, it's cumulative.
translation.ja: 体を傷つけ続けると それが蓄積する

translation.en: And ultimately, that led to Nick getting a very bad squeeze.
translation.ja: 最終的に ニックは ひどいスクイズを起こし

translation.en: And we… we couldn't save him.
translation.ja: 僕らには救えなかった

translation.en: Of course, we have our medics who will be giving a pep talk as well.
translation.ja: 次は医療スタッフの挨拶

translation.en: Okay, I'll keep this pretty quick.
translation.ja: 手短に話します

translation.en: If we think someone might be in danger, we have the authority
translation.ja: 危険な状態のダイバーを 私たちは止める権限がある 危険な状態のダイバーを 私たちは止める権限がある 呼吸療法士 リー

translation.en: to tell a diver that they cannot dive any longer.
translation.ja: 危険な状態のダイバーを 私たちは止める権限がある 呼吸療法士 リー

translation.en: I always say to them, I want you to go home. To be able to get on that plane and go home to your family.
translation.ja: “家族の待つ自宅に 帰ってほしい”と伝える

translation.en: And secondly, I don't ever want them to be that diver that's on oxygen at the age of 40
translation.ja: 40歳で酸素吸入器が必要な ダイバーになってほしくない

translation.en: because they've messed up their lungs so terribly.
translation.ja: それじゃ肺はボロボロ

translation.en: In competition, we have to retrieve a tag attached to the bottom plate at target depth as a proof.
translation.ja: 大会ではタグを回収して 目標達成の証拠にする

translation.en: She's reaching for her tag.
translation.ja: タグを手にしてる

translation.en: A white card is a 100% valid performance.
translation.ja: ホワイトカードなら有効

translation.en: - Yeah! - Yes!
translation.ja: やった

translation.en: As soon as somebody helps you, or you lose control, even on the surface, that's disqualification. It's a red card.
translation.ja: 水面でも誰かの手を借りたら 失格でレッドカード

translation.en: Over two weeks of competition, the athletes get six attempts each.
translation.ja: ２週間の大会中 選手は６回 挑戦できる

translation.en: It's very simple. The deepest dive wins.
translation.ja: 単純に最も深く潜れば勝ち

translation.en: …is coming to meet you.
translation.ja: 後で来るわ

translation.en: Okay.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: I want to do so much. Yeah.
translation.ja: この時を待っていたわ

translation.en: A world record, that's the main point. So, I mean, it's super important for me.
translation.ja: 私にとって重要なのは 世界記録を出すこと

translation.en: It was clear that Alessia was after the world record.
translation.ja: アレッシアは明らかに 世界記録を狙っていた

translation.en: So she was going to push her limits.
translation.ja: 限界を超えようとしていたわ

translation.en: Unfortunately, Alessia had a problem with the dark.
translation.ja: でも彼女は暗闇が苦手だった

translation.en: And Vertical Blue is unique in that it's this collapsed cave.
translation.ja: バーチカルブルーは 独特な崩れた洞穴よ

translation.en: It's like going into space.
translation.ja: 宇宙空間みたい

translation.en: She's on her way back.
translation.ja: 彼女が戻ってくる

translation.en: We've got Stephen Keenan, who's our deep primary safety, and he's going to meet her.
translation.ja: 主要救助ダイバーの スティーヴンが彼女の元へ

translation.en: Well done, Alessia.
translation.ja: 見事よ アレッシア

translation.en: - Breathe. - Breathe.
translation.ja: 呼吸して

translation.en: - Breathe, breathe, breathe. - Breathe. Breathe.
translation.ja: ほら 息を吸って

translation.en: - I'm okay. -
translation.ja: “大丈夫(アイム･オーケー)”

translation.en: I'm okay.
translation.ja: “大丈夫”

translation.en: The judges are conferring.
translation.ja: 審判らが協議

translation.en: I'm sorry, Alessia, red card.
translation.ja: 残念だけど レッドカード

translation.en: Grab her. Keep her up.
translation.ja: 彼女を浮かせて

translation.en: Support her. Just support her.
translation.ja: 彼女を支えて

translation.en: Just support her head.
translation.ja: 頭を支えて

translation.en: - Breathe. - Somebody hold her.
translation.ja: 息をして 誰か僕のために彼女を抱えて

translation.en: Hold her for me. Up.
translation.ja: 誰か僕のために彼女を抱えて

translation.en: Up. You okay?
translation.ja: 意識はある？

translation.en: Come on. Hold her.
translation.ja: 彼女を支えて

translation.en: She was really pushing hard, experiencing blackouts several times.
translation.ja: 彼女は かなり無理をして 何度か失神した

translation.en: A lot of free divers were not approving her way.
translation.ja: 多くの選手は よく思ってなかったね

translation.en: I'm checking Alessia for potential lung squeeze.
translation.ja: 肺のスクイズが起きてないか 確認した

translation.en: So I did ask her, Are you coughing up any blood? And, um… and she said no. And, um…
translation.ja: 血を吐いたか尋ねると 彼女は否定したけど…

translation.en: And, in all honesty, I kinda… I didn't believe her.
translation.ja: 信じられなかった

translation.en: Listen.
translation.ja: 聞いて

translation.en: You can't do that again. Not here.
translation.ja: もう無理よ　今回はダメ

translation.en: I want you to succeed. That is why I want you to plan.
translation.ja: あなたの成功を願ってるから 計画的にやって

translation.en: You-- you gotta quell the horses.
translation.ja: もう少し落ち着いて

translation.en: We told her she couldn't dive for a day or two.
translation.ja: 彼女の潜水を １〜２日 禁じた

translation.en: She gets mad, and she goes and swims across the bay.
translation.ja: 彼女は怒って泳いでいった

translation.en: And being that she just blacked out, we don't want her to have an issue, you know, a mile away.
translation.ja: 失神したばかりだから 心配だったわ

translation.en: Alessia!
translation.ja: アレッシア

translation.en: She didn't win too many friends with that behavior.
translation.ja: あれじゃ 友達は あまりできない

translation.en: Some people saw it as…
translation.ja: 人によっては⸺

translation.en: yeah, the wrong kind of reaction.
translation.ja: 不適切だと思うだろう

translation.en: Alessia had a very high temper, and, boy, you knew it.
translation.ja: アレッシアは とても短気だったの

translation.en: Why the hell are you getting angry? You had a bad start. Chill out.
translation.ja: なぜ怒ってるの？ 冷静になって

translation.en: There were hecklers who said she didn't look like she could muscle up these depths.
translation.ja: 彼女の体は筋肉不足だと 批判する人たちも居た

translation.en: The Internet trolls were robust in their criticism.
translation.ja: ネットには ひどい言葉があふれていたわ

translation.en: Hello. I'm making this video to reassure everyone who cares about me that I'm fine.
translation.ja: 私は元気だと伝えたくて この動画を撮った

translation.en: And to disprove the rumors on Facebook that I passed out at 20 meters.
translation.ja: 水深20メートルで 気絶したってウワサはウソ

translation.en: I had no problems with a lung squeeze.
translation.ja: スクイズも起こしてない

translation.en: The dive overall went well, and I ask you not to write lies.
translation.ja: 順調にやってるから ウソを広めるのはやめて

translation.en: Keep the head in a neutral position, not letting it hyperextend.
translation.ja: 頭は伸ばし過ぎないで

translation.en: The tongue and liquids and fluids can go down into the larynx and cause more of a spasm.
translation.ja: 舌や液体が喉頭に入り込んで けいれんが起きる

translation.en: We would have a meeting every morning to go over every single diver.
translation.ja: ダイバー全員に 毎朝 講習を行った

translation.en: She was out for a while but remembered nothing.
translation.ja: 彼女は気絶したが 何も覚えてなかった

translation.en: She just said she came up and there she was. Okay?
translation.ja: 彼女は気絶したが 何も覚えてなかった いい？

translation.en: Stephen was so good at knowing the ones that could be in danger.
translation.ja: スティーヴンは 危うい選手を把握して

translation.en: He studied them, and he knew their weaknesses.
translation.ja: 彼らの弱点を研究していた

translation.en: He would say, We gotta watch out for this one. And he was dead- on every time. Kind of freakishly so.
translation.ja: スティーヴンの予想は 毎回 不気味なほど当たった

translation.en: With Alessia, it was driving Stephen absolutely crazy,
translation.ja: 彼はアレッシアに いらだっていた

translation.en: because he was seeing all of these little things that she was doing wrong,
translation.ja: 彼は全部 分かっていたんだもの

translation.en: and that it was probably contributing to her blackouts.
translation.ja: 失神につながる 彼女の悪い癖をね

translation.en: And so he started training with Alessia during the competition break.
translation.ja: だから休息期間に アレッシアと練習を始めた

translation.en: Breathe.
translation.ja: 息をして

translation.en: Breathe.
translation.ja: 呼吸して

translation.en: - Are you okay? - I am okay.
translation.ja: どう？ “大丈夫”

translation.en: He inspired trust straight away.
translation.ja: すぐ彼を信じられた

translation.en: I saw in him the only one who could coach me.
translation.ja: 私のコーチが務まるのは 彼だけ

translation.en: Are you okay?
translation.ja: 平気？

translation.en: The thing that struck me most was his eyes.
translation.ja: 一番 印象的だったのは 彼の瞳

translation.en: They were blue, so blue, like the sea.
translation.ja: 海のように真っ青だった

translation.en: His gaze was enough. Before diving, we would look at each other.
translation.ja: 私たちは潜る前いつも お互いを見つめた

translation.en: And this gave me strength.
translation.ja: それで力をもらえた

translation.en: Feeling his presence made you feel safe in the darkness.
translation.ja: 暗闇の中でも 彼の存在を感じると安心した

translation.en: We see a special relationship between the safety diver and the athlete.
translation.ja: 救助ダイバーと選手には 特別な絆があるようですね

translation.en: For example, Alessia asks about you in every deep dive she does.
translation.ja: アレッシアは深く潜る時 あなたを気にしています

translation.en: It's massively important, because, um… free diving is a very psychological sport.
translation.ja: フリーダイビングは メンタルが重要な競技だ

translation.en: Okay? There's many little facets that can affect a dive.
translation.ja: こまごましたことが 潜水に影響する

translation.en: And if somebody, when diving, wants to feel secure,
translation.ja: 選手が安心して潜りたい時に

translation.en: they're very happy if they're diving with someone they're familiar with, and they know that the safety diver is familiar with them.
translation.ja: なじみのある救助ダイバーと 一緒なら 満足するだろう

translation.en: How they dive. The speed they go at. The habits they might have. Things to look out for that we know.
translation.ja: 潜り方や目標速度 癖に 救助ダイバーが目を配れる

translation.en: As she arrived on the other side of the Arch, the safety line should be there in the middle.
translation.ja: アーチをくぐった先には ロープがあって⸺

translation.en: Steve would be there at the end of the line waiting for her.
translation.ja: スティーヴンが待っている

translation.en: Natalia crossed the Arch with a monofin.
translation.ja: ナタリアは モノフィンを使った

translation.en: What Alessia prepared for was a dive without the monofin, which is the hardest way you can do it.
translation.ja: アレッシアは使わずに 最も難しい方法を選んだ

translation.en: Maybe she wanted to do it that way to be better than the best free diver ever.
translation.ja: 史上最高のフリーダイバーを 超えたかったのね

translation.en: Everything was timed. They had made practice runs
translation.ja: 予行演習で 全ての時間を計った

translation.en: to know how long exactly it takes her to go down to 52 meters,
translation.ja: 彼女が52メートル潜るのに かかる時間も⸺

translation.en: how long it takes for her to swim horizontally for 30 meters.
translation.ja: 横に30メートル泳ぐのに かかる時間も

translation.en: And we had a countdown,
translation.ja: 最終チェックもした

translation.en: so we would make sure that Steve would be already there before she arrived.
translation.ja: 彼女が くぐり終える時 スティーヴンが居るようにね

translation.en: I go down with the other two technical divers with a camera to do the filming.
translation.ja: 私は撮影のため テックダイバー２人と海へ

translation.en: After she goes down, my job was to hold the rope,
translation.ja: 彼女が潜ったら 僕はロープを握り

translation.en: wait until we felt her hit the bottom,
translation.ja: 彼女が下に着くまで待つ

translation.en: go down a few meters, look. If she wasn't coming back up, come up and we're done.
translation.ja: 数メートル潜り 彼女が戻らないのを確認する

translation.en: After she swam through the Arch, she was relying on finding the rope on the other side to pull herself back up.
translation.ja: 彼女はアーチを泳ぎ抜けたら ロープを頼りに水面へ向かう

translation.en: Five, four, three, two, one, zero.
We watched Alessia go down.
translation.ja: 彼女が潜るのを見守った

translation.en: I'm feeling the rope, so I can tell when she reaches the bottom.
translation.ja: ロープを握り 彼女が下に着くのを確かめる

translation.en: After we felt her let go of the rope, we'd give an okay sign
translation.ja: 彼女がロープを手放したのを 感じたら

translation.en: to tell the other safety divers that she entered the Arch.
translation.ja: 彼女がアーチに入ったと 周囲に知らせる

translation.en: That should've triggered Steve to go down.
translation.ja: そして スティーヴンは海へ

translation.en: Ten seconds.
I started to give the countdown to Steve.
translation.ja: 彼にカウントダウンを開始

translation.en: Five, four, three.
He asked me for ten more seconds.
translation.ja: 彼は“もう10秒”と

translation.en: I just didn't really understand why, because, um… so far, everything had been going according to plan.
translation.ja: 全部 計画どおりだったから 理由が分からなかった

translation.en: So maybe the heart was going a bit too fast for his liking,
translation.ja: 全部 計画どおりだったから 理由が分からなかった 彼の鼓動を抑えるために もう数秒 必要だったのかも

translation.en: so he wanted to take a few more seconds to be really ready.
translation.ja: 彼の鼓動を抑えるために もう数秒 必要だったのかも

translation.en: I really don't know, because you can't discuss with him, because he's preparing for his dive, so he's not gonna talk.
translation.ja: 彼は潜水の準備中で 本音は確かめられなかった

translation.en: It took him a little bit extra to give me the signal.
translation.ja: 予定より時間が かかった

translation.en: Alessia is coming out of the Arch, but Steve is not there.
translation.ja: アーチの先に スティーヴンは居なかった

translation.en: She doesn't see the rope. She is swimming the wrong direction.
translation.ja: アレッシアはロープが見えず 誤った方向へ

translation.en: She didn't realize that she was already out.
translation.ja: アーチを出たと 気付いてなかった

translation.en: I have, uh, one hand on the rope.
translation.ja: ロープを握りながら

translation.en: I'm waiting for the feel of the pull to say that they're starting to come up.
translation.ja: ２人が浮上してくる感覚を 待っていた

translation.en: The pull is not coming. I start to worry.
translation.ja: でも 何の感覚も無く 心配になった

translation.en: Maybe she was swimming a little bit slower. Let's wait a little bit longer.
translation.ja: 手間取っているのかと思い もう少し待つことに

translation.en: They should've been coming up
translation.ja: もう浮上する頃だ

translation.en: by the time we swam across to the other side. I knew at that point something was wrong.
translation.ja: 間違いが起きたと あの時 分かった

translation.en: Now it's too long.
translation.ja: 長すぎる

translation.en: Something is not right.
translation.ja: 何かが おかしい

translation.en: Alessia needs to go up immediately.
translation.ja: 彼女は すぐ浮上すべきだった

translation.en: She didn't know that she's in completely the wrong place.
translation.ja: 間違った場所だと 分かってなかった

translation.en: In one moment, Steve left the rope super quickly.
translation.ja: スティーヴンが ロープから素早く離れた

translation.en: As a scuba diver, I cannot do shit. I was very far.
translation.ja: スキューバダイバーだから 私は遠くて何もできず⸺

translation.en: I was just screaming.
translation.ja: ただ叫んでいた

translation.en: I could see all the way to the end of the line. There was no one.
translation.ja: ロープの先まで見えたけど 誰も居なかった

translation.en: We just can't see them.
translation.ja: ２人が見えない

translation.en: Think fast. Maybe the water current took them.
translation.ja: 流されたのかもと とっさに考えた

translation.en: We would need to search a much bigger area.
translation.ja: より広範囲の捜索へ

translation.en: Thirty meters away, there was loads and loads of tourists snorkeling.
translation.ja: 30メートル先には 大勢の観光客が居た

translation.en: We're looking for someone amongst a mess of people that can't properly swim.
translation.ja: 泳ぎの素人たちの間で ２人を捜した

translation.en: Everywhere I look, they're not there.
translation.ja: ２人の姿は無かった

translation.en: I decided to come up and see if I could see them on the surface.
translation.ja: 水面に居るかと思い 浮上してみた

translation.en: There was no explanation.
translation.ja: 手がかりゼロ

translation.en: I was swimming as fast as I could.
translation.ja: できるだけ速く泳いだわ

translation.en: I need to see if they are alive.
translation.ja: ２人の生存を 確認するためにね

translation.en: The first meters, everything seemed normal.
translation.ja: 最初の数メートルは 何の問題も無かった

translation.en: Until I reached the Arch.
translation.ja: アーチまではね

translation.en: I remember while I was swimming, I felt it was a bit strenuous.
translation.ja: 泳ぐのが少し苦しかったのを 覚えている

translation.en: There was a problem.
translation.ja: 問題が起きた

translation.en: Steve wasn't there, but neither was the rope.
translation.ja: スティーヴンの姿も ロープも無かった

translation.en: I just tried to follow the reef, trying to see where the rope was.
translation.ja: ロープを探そうと サンゴ礁に沿って進んでみた

translation.en: But I realized I couldn't find it.
translation.ja: でも見つからないと悟ったわ

translation.en: I'd made a mistake.
translation.ja: ミスを犯した

translation.en: I suddenly saw Steve in front of me. I remember he took my hands.
translation.ja: スティーヴンが急に現れ 私の両手をつかんだ

translation.en: And he swam, bringing me to the surface.
translation.ja: 彼は泳いで私を水面へ

translation.en: I don't remember the first seconds when I surfaced. I only remember, after a while,
translation.ja: 水面に浮上した直後のことは 覚えてないし

translation.en: looking around and not understanding a thing.
translation.ja: 何も分かってなかった

translation.en: Steve's face was in the water.
translation.ja: スティーヴンの顔は水の中

translation.en: And I started screaming on her, like, Turn him face up!
translation.ja: “彼を仰向けにして”と 叫んだわ

translation.en: But I didn't realize that she had blacked out.
translation.ja: でも彼女は失神していた

translation.en: And when I started screaming, because I really screamed a lot,
translation.ja: 私が何度も叫んだから 彼女は意識を取り戻して すぐ行動した

translation.en: she basically woke up, and she started acting immediately.
translation.ja: 彼女は意識を取り戻して すぐ行動した

translation.en: Maybe I could have done more. If I had been more conscious, I don't know.
translation.ja: もっと意識がしっかりあれば 他にも何かできたのかも

translation.en: If you are on your own, and you start blacking out, you have to be on your back. If you're not on your back, you're done.
translation.ja: 独りの時 気絶しかけたら 仰向けにならなきゃ死ぬ

translation.en: Steve probably took his last seconds of consciousness
translation.ja: 彼は意識を失う数秒前に 彼女を生存できる体勢に したんだろう

translation.en: to make sure she was in a position that she'd survive in
translation.ja: 彼女を生存できる体勢に したんだろう

translation.en: at the expense of ending up face down.
translation.ja: その犠牲で 自分は うつ伏せに

translation.en: The worst thing is we couldn't do anything. We couldn't save him.
translation.ja: 最悪なことに 私たちは彼を救えなかった

translation.en: He rescued me, but I couldn't rescue him.
translation.ja: 私は彼に助けてもらったのに

translation.en: He was a hero, and he showed it till the end.
translation.ja: 彼は最期まで英雄だった

translation.en: You can see in the last photo, he lost his life to save hers.
translation.ja: 最後の写真は 彼女のために命を落とす彼

translation.en: I was diving the lighthouse. Like, actually, over there.
translation.ja: 俺は あの灯台の辺りを 潜っていた

translation.en: I finish my dive, I… I look at my phone,
translation.ja: ダイビングを終えてから 携帯を見た

translation.en: even, like, with my suit on, like, I… My phone, I look at my phone, like, What?
translation.ja: ウェットスーツを着たまま 携帯を見て驚いたよ

translation.en: Like, there are 50 missed calls.
translation.ja: 不在着信が約50件

translation.en: And I received a phone call.
translation.ja: 電話があった

translation.en: Something happened to Steve. And…
translation.ja: スティーヴンの身に 何かあって…

translation.en: It… They couldn't bring him back.
translation.ja: 助からなかった

translation.en: My first reaction was, Shit. I wasn't there.
translation.ja: その場に居なかったのを 悔やんだ

translation.en: I could've saved him if I would have been there.
translation.ja: “俺なら救えたかも”と

translation.en: He was choosing her over himself.
translation.ja: 彼女の命を優先したのよ

translation.en: I'm very clear that he knew that someone was gonna die that day, and he wasn't gonna let it be her.
translation.ja: 誰か死ぬと分かっていて 彼女に生きてほしかったのね

translation.en: I would give my life.
translation.ja: 命を譲りたい

translation.en: Mine instead of his.
translation.ja: 彼のために

translation.en: He wouldn't… he wouldn't have forgiven himself if he wouldn't have saved her, you know?
translation.ja: 彼女を救わなきゃ 気が済まなかったんだろう

translation.en: Everybody, we'll just dive until we feel
translation.ja: みんな 潜ってちょうだい

translation.en: we want to release our flowers and give thanks for such a wonderful human in our lives,
translation.ja: 花をまき 偉大な人と 出会ったことに感謝して

translation.en: sending all the good energy that Stephen gave to all of us.
translation.ja: スティーヴンがくれた力を 送ってあげて

translation.en: Everybody who loved Stephen did a big underwater vigil.
translation.ja: 息子を愛した人々が集まって 水中で祈ってくれた

translation.en: They all held their breath for 39 seconds to represent each year of his life.
translation.ja: 息子の39年の人生を象徴して 39秒間 息を止めてくれた

translation.en: There was never ever a death which moved the place the way that this… this one did.
translation.ja: 誰かの死が あんなに 影響を与えたのは初めてよ

translation.en: It was hundreds of people. I mean, everybody.
translation.ja: 何百もの人々が集まった

translation.en: How? How can one person touch so many?
translation.ja: たった１人が 大勢の心を動かした

translation.en: He must've been a pretty special person, right?
translation.ja: 彼は特別な人間だったんだ

translation.en: Part of grief is kind of selfish.
translation.ja: 悲しみの一部は主観的なもの

translation.en: And the selfish part of grief… makes me miss him. I miss him.
translation.ja: 悲しみの一部は主観的なもの 息子が恋しい

translation.en: I miss him not coming home. I miss him in my life.
translation.ja: もう息子は帰ってこないのが つらい

translation.en: But I am much consoled by how he lived. He was pretty courageous.
translation.ja: でも 息子の勇敢な生き方を 思い出すと心が楽になる

translation.en: The Masai plains.
translation.ja: マサイ平原だ

translation.en: We're completely alone.
translation.ja: 他に誰も居ない

translation.en: Jebel Toubkal.
translation.ja: ツブカル山

translation.en: Nice mountain in North Africa.
translation.ja: 北アフリカの山だ

translation.en: Stephen was searching for something all of his life.
translation.ja: 息子は生涯 探し物をしていた

translation.en: I did it!
translation.ja: やった

translation.en: He had found something he loved and somebody who shared his dream.
translation.ja: 息子は愛する物を見つけて 同じ夢を抱く人に出会った

translation.en: Alessia and the sea. They were all he needed.
translation.ja: アレッシアと海こそが 息子に必要だった

translation.en: He will always be with me.
translation.ja: これからも彼は一緒よ

translation.en: I remember his eyes…
translation.ja: 彼の瞳を思い出し…

translation.en: and try to remember all the things he'd tell me.
translation.ja: 彼の言葉は全部 忘れない

translation.en: To live, to be happy.
translation.ja: 生きて幸せになる

translation.en: To believe in myself.
translation.ja: 自分を信じる

translation.en: Enjoy yourself to the max!
translation.ja: 極限まで楽しんで

translation.en: Okay? Kiss.
translation.ja: じゃあ キス

translation.en: I try and remember his hugs.
translation.ja: 彼のハグを覚えていたい

translation.en: He's the person who made me realize what it really means to hug someone.
translation.ja: 抱き締めることの意味を 彼が教えてくれた

translation.en: From the hug, you'd understand how deeply he cared about you
translation.ja: 抱き合うことで 彼の優しさが分かり

translation.en: and all the feelings you could share together.
translation.ja: 全ての感情が伝わった

translation.en: He gave his life
translation.ja: 彼は命を捧げた

translation.en: for Alessia.
translation.ja: 私の娘に

translation.en: A pain like this stays with you.
translation.ja: この苦しみは消えない

translation.en: You go on.
translation.ja: 人生は続く

translation.en: But that wound is there, and it won't heal.
translation.ja: だが この傷は治らず ずっと残る

translation.en: He will always be in my heart.
translation.ja: 彼は私の中に居る

translation.en: He's going to be with me forever,
translation.ja: 永遠に一緒よ

translation.en: because I want him to stay with me for the rest of my life.
translation.ja: これからも ずっと彼と過ごしたい
